page.title: 07Cherrycroft Cottage page 2
page.content: A goad is a whip or a stick measuring 13 feet and used for prodding cattle to move forward. it is interesting to note that most cottages built about this time had rooms measuring 13 feet. The furniture would have been very plain an simple and made of wood. The windows in the cottage are small because of the superstition that the deavil would not come throught small windows. Each house has a living room, kitchen and bedroom. It was usual for families to be large. The children would have to sleep in the parents room or in the loft. there are two wells in the garden of Cherrycroft cottage. Mrs. meller does not use the well water. The well a covered over. Cherrycroft cottage is now a single house for Mrs. meller who has lived there for 10 years.
